subhead: Crowds erupted in celebration across Gaza and the West Bank as Israel released detainees in exchange for hostages, marking the first phase of a US-brokered truce.

title: Macron blames parties for destabilizing PM as budget showdown looms
subhead: 'Many of those who have fueled division and speculation have not risen to the moment,' the French president said upon his arrival in Egypt on Monday, where he is attending the Gaza summit.

title: Philippe Aghion, Peter Howitt and Joel Mokyr win 2025 Nobel Prize in Economics
subhead: Howitt and Aghion received the honor for their endogenous growth model developed in the late 1980s. Mokyr was recognized for his research on the link between knowledge and economic growth.

title: Paris urban transport museum to open in 2032
subhead: The RATP, Paris's public transport company, aims to create a site dedicated to the history of its metro and buses in the capital's 18th arrondissement.

title: New French cabinet shows Macron is still calling shots
subhead: Unveiled Sunday night, the new government led by reappointed Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu faces two no-confidence votes this week and must push through a budget before year's end.

title: Why foreigners love France but struggle with the French
subhead: While France captivates with its culture and lifestyle, the French, frequently caricatured as arrogant and impolite, often have a poor reputation. This ambivalence raises questions about the roots of anti-French sentiment abroad.

title: Canada's hottest village lives on despite the constant fear of wildfires
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (2/6) Lytton, British Columbia, was consumed by flames in 2021. As the fires have grown ever more destructive, some residents have returned, determined to stay.
